alert.note: Alert for Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 12:37PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Wisconsin, including the following area, Sawyer County. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM CDT, Rapid snowmelt is causing minor flooding. Law enforcement reported water was over several roads and additional flooding is possible. - Rain this weekend with increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected to continue. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chippewa Flowage East, Chippewa Flowage West, Stone Lake, Winter, Radisson, Exeland, Couderay, New Post, Chief Lake on Chippewa Flowage, Little Round Lake, Edgewater, Ojibwa, Chippewa Lake, Lac Courte Oreilles Reservation, Chief Lake, Blaisdell Lake, Loretta, Reserve, Northwoods Beach and Deer Lake. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
